artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Muneoka Nobukichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 460.13; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 183, p. 278.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; crouching man on a rocky overhang, wearing red, black, yellow and white armor and a green flowered garment and black hat, holding a black fan; woman wearing a headdress with a torri gate on top and flowing green and yellow garments, with the moon behind her hear, appearing in ULQ behind a large wave in turbulent water
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫工宗岡 {horikō Muneoka}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Yoshitoshi's Unsurpassed Warriors (Yoshitoshi musha burui 芳年武者旡類)
title: Tōtōmi-no-kami Hōjō Tokimasa
